text: car enthusiasts have a warm spot in

United States
Hodel in contrast Ford moved about three
hundred and six thousand escapes cx-5 s
competitor this 2016 model is a
mid-cycle refresh yes that is a new
grille and these are LED headlamps the
kind found on luxury cars of course this
is a well optioned Grand Touring model
priced at just under 34 grand not
inexpensive but with loads of safety
texts such as blind spot and lane
departure warning plus radar assisted
cruise control it is a good value the
interior gets a new design and electric
parking brake and trim that wouldn't

the larger of two available engines this
2.5 liter 4-cylinder delivers 184
horsepower there's 185 pound feet of
torque
the gearbox has six speeds and the sport
mode but no paddle shifters surprising
acceleration is good in class zero to
sixty Sprint's happen in eight seconds
the suspension is tuned towards the firm
side of comfortable if you were driving
blindfolded something I will not
encourage you probably would swear
you're driving something German
something with a premium badge true to
Mazdas reputation cx-5 is great fun to
chuck in corners hopefully the kids
don't get motion sickness fuel economy
doesn't suffer I'm seeing a solid 25
miles per gallon average equipped with
all-wheel drive like many automatic
transmissions these days this one up
shifts aggressively for better fuel
economy it can be eliminated by going
into sport mode but that holds lower
gears a lot longer or something a little
too sporty for crossover it would be
nice to have something in between the

to enjoy the Bose system this cx-5 is
equipped with an automatic braking
system that has the potential of

don't know what could possibly go wrong

some wilderness Duty probably a lot more

back to the interior the upgrade is
nicely done with soft materials though I
will nitpick gauge cluster graphics
could use a modern color display adjust
the wheel fully forward and startups are
awkward faux stitching close to the
drivers eyes is a faux pas the user
interface is one of the better setups
controlled both by an intuitive knob and
by touch it's a hassle to find radio
presets though seats are nicely sculpted
big drivers may find them snug they're
heated ventilation is not an option the
seats don't slide fore-and-aft if you
want to max out cargo room but Mazda
gives you loads of legroom loads of foot
room heated seats back here and a power
port would be appreciated but
at least the rooms decent three adults
will be okay here if they're spelt the
